p: Influenza RdRp displays a significantly higher fidelity than human immunodeficiency virus-1 reverse transcriptase and T7 RNA polymerase and an equivalent or higher fidelity than murine leukemia virus reverse transcriptase ( Aggarwal et al., 2010). The mutation frequency of influenza RdRp is 7.06 × 10 −4 nucleotides in wild-type H3N2 virus ( Cheung et al., 2014) and >7.26 × 10 −5 nucleotides deduced from 108 sequenced clones of an average of 849 bases from the database ( Drake, 1993), and these values are much larger than those of herpesvirus DNA polymerases with proofreading activity at the levels of 1.38 × 10 −7 per nucleotide ( Lee et al., 2015) to 3 × 10 −9 substitutions per site per year ( McGeoch, Dolan, & Ralph, 2000). These results indicate the low fidelity of the RdRp activity of influenza lacking proofreading activity.
